medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient was referred for further evaluation due to thickened nuchal translucency (NT) and indistinct fetal nasal bones on the initial ultrasound.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initial ultrasound at 13 weeks 2 days gestation showed an NT of 3.4 mm, absence of nasal bones, and poor ossifications in the cranium and vertebrae. A follow-up ultrasound at 21 weeks 4 days indicated a slight improvement in cranium ossification with some hypo-mineralization, persistent unidentified nasal bones, poorly ossified vertebrae, femur and humerus lengths below the tenth percentile, and bowing of the tibia and fibula.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous spontaneous abortion at 45 days of gestation.
medical_history.family_history: No pertinent family history in both parents and other family members.
